Fish Stocks Data Explorer: Explore available data on the world's fish stocks.
Fish biomass relative to biomass at maximum sustainable yield
column3:
Biomass is measured as the biomass of a fish stock in a given year divided by the biomass at its maximum sustainable yield (B / Bmsy).

Biomass greater than one means fish biomass is above the maximum sustainable yield. A value of one maximises fish catch without decreasing fish populations.

Fish Stocks Data Explorer: Fish biomass relative to biomass at management target
column3:
Biomass is measured as the biomass of a fish stock in a given year divided by the biomass at its management target level (B / Bmgt).

Biomass greater than one means fish biomass is above the management target. A value of one maximises fish catch without decreasing fish populations.

Fish Stocks Data Explorer: Fishing pressure relative to rate at maximum sustainable yield
column3:
Fishing pressure is measured as the fishing pressure in a given year divided by the pressure which would hold fish populations at the maximum sustainable yield.

A value of one means pressure is the optimal level to maximize fish catch without declining fish populations. Greater than one means fishing is too high and populations will be in decline.

Fish Stocks Data Explorer: Fishing pressure relative to rate at management target
column3:
Fishing pressure is measured as the fishing pressure in a given year divided by the pressure which would hold fish populations at the management target for that stock.

A value of one means pressure is the optimal level to maintain fish populations at the target level. Greater than one means fishing is too high and populations will be in decline.

Fish Stocks Data Explorer: Fish catch relative to catch at maximum sustainable yield
Fish catch relative to catch at management target
